## What is R Markdown?
Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. You can embed and evaluate code chunks within these documents. This cheatsheet focuses on R. Nevertheless you can use other engines as well. To install R Markdown type the following command in your R shell:
```{r install, echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
install.packages("rmarkdown")
```
Makdown documents have the extension $.Rmd$ and consist of three types of content. 1. Metainformation like title and author, 2. code chunks and 3. text.

## Code Cunks
Start Code Chunk: ``` ```{[engine] [options]} ```  
End Code Chunk: ``` ``` ```  
Alernatively click on ![](insert.png){width=40px} and choose your desired chunk or use the shortcut **Ctrl + Alt + i** (OS X: **Cmd + Option + i**)  
Common Options for Chunks:

* ``` engine ```: Declare the engine to evaluate code chunk (e.g. ```engine='python'```). Engines like ```bash``` and ```sql``` are also available.
* ``` eval ```: If ```FALSE``` code chunk will not be evaluated (e.g. ```eval=FALSE```)
* ``` include ```: If ```FALSE``` code chunk will run but not be included in document
* ``` echo ```: If ```FALSE``` code will not be displayed above the results of the cunk
* ``` results ```: If ```hide``` the codes result will not be desplayed
* ``` message ```: If ```FALSE``` no messages generated by the code will be displayed
* ``` fig.width ``` | ``` fig.height ```: Width | Height in inches if code produces plots

Click on the link to see all options: [rmarkdowm-reference.pdf](https://www.rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/rmarkdown-reference.pdf)  
You can also use Inline Code for short code starting and ending with a single apostrophe ` ` `. Do not forget to declare yor engine (e.g. ``` `r ` ```)  
Tables to present data with ` knitr ` package: ``` knitr::kable(yourdata) ```

## Text
You can use specifix syntax to format your text.
```
# Header 1
## Header 2 
### Header 3 
*italic* 
**bold** 
```  
Unordered List:
```
* Item 1
* Item 2
    + Item 2a
    + Item 2b
```  
Ordered List:  
```
1. Item 1
2. Item 2
    + Item 2a
    + Item 2b
```  
Inline Equation: This Formula ` $E = mc^{2}$ ` is within the text. $\rightarrow$ This Formula $E = mc^{2}$ is within the text.
Equation Block:
```
$$
a = 2 \cdot \frac{a}{e^{\beta_{0}+2}}
$$
```  
$$

## Meta Information (YAML header)
Meta Information is written in the header and are given as key:value pairs.
```
---
title: "R Markdown Cheatsheet"
output: pdf_document
author: Magdalena Breu, Janna, Niklas Speckle
---
```

## Compile
```{r eval=FALSE}
library(rmarkdown)
render("mymarkdowm.Rmd", output_format = "pdf_document")
```
Most common output formats are: ` html_document `, ` pdf_document `, ` word_document `. You can also click on ![](knit.png){width=40px} and choose your desired output format. But there are many more: [Output Formats](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/lesson-9.html)
